episodeTitle: A Trap on Lovely Street! The Almighty Eneru!
episodeTitleAlternate: A Trap on Lovely Street! His Highness Eneru
japanesTitle: ラブリー通りの罠！全能なる神（ゴッド）エネル
romanizedTitle: Raburī Dōri no Wana! Zennō naru Goddo Eneru
description: Conis leads Luffy, Sanji, and Usopp through Lovely Street marketplace toward the Gondola Port, but her conscience overwhelms her. She confesses that their mission is a trap designed by Enel, risking her own life. When Enel detects her betrayal through his Mantra, he attacks with a devastating lightning strike. Gan Fall and Pierre rescue the group, and Luffy resolves to proceed to Upper Yard to save his separated crew members.

events.title: Straw Hats Enter Lovely Street
events.description: Luffy, Sanji, and Usopp, guided by Conis, enter the marketplace of Lovely Street on Angel Island. The citizens noticeably avoid them and treat them with suspicion as 'criminals' who entered Skypiea illegally.
events.significance: Establishes the oppressive atmosphere under Enel's rule where citizens are afraid to interact with outsiders and must follow strict laws under threat of divine punishment.

events.title: Luffy Notices Conis's Fear
events.description: As they walk through Lovely Street, Luffy observes that Conis has been trembling since they left her house. Usopp also senses something is wrong based on the hostile reactions from the townspeople.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's perceptiveness about people's emotions despite his carefree demeanor, and foreshadows Conis's internal conflict about betraying the Straw Hats.

quotes.text: Why have you been trembling since we left your house?
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy confronts Conis about her suspicious behavior

events.title: Conis's Confession
events.description: Overwhelmed by guilt and conscience, Conis tearfully confesses to Luffy, Sanji, and Usopp that she called the Express Speedy Shrimp to take their ship and friends to Upper Yard as a trap. She explains that it's the 'civic responsibility' of Skypieans to guide illegal entrants to be judged by Enel, and that failure to do so results in death.
events.significance: This is a pivotal character moment showing Conis choosing morality over self-preservation, defying Enel's oppressive rule despite knowing she will face deadly consequences. It reveals the true extent of Enel's tyrannical control over Skypiea through fear.

quotes.text: I called for the super-express speedy shrimp... Now that I've told you the plan, my life is in danger.
quotes.speaker: Conis
quotes.context: Conis reveals her role in the trap and acknowledges the consequences

events.title: Enel Uses Mantra to Detect Conis
events.description: From his distant shrine, Enel uses his Mantra (Observation Haki) ability to detect Conis's confession. His Mantra is enhanced by his Goro Goro no Mi Devil Fruit, allowing him to pick up electromagnetic waves and overhear conversations across all of Skypiea.
events.significance: First demonstration in this episode of Enel's god-like surveillance capabilities through Mantra, establishing him as an omniscient threat who can monitor his entire domain. This introduces the concept of Observation Haki to the anime audience, though it's called Mantra in Skypiea.

events.title: El Thor - Heaven's Judgment Attack
events.description: Enel unleashes El Thor (called 'Heaven's Judgment' by Skypieans) on Conis for betraying him. A massive column of lightning crashes down from the sky, creating a huge explosion that destroys several houses on Lovely Street. Luffy tries to run while holding Conis, but the beam is too wide to escape.
events.significance: This is the first time in the anime that Enel directly uses his devastating El Thor technique, demonstrating his ability to execute divine punishment from anywhere in Skypiea. The attack establishes Enel as an incredibly dangerous antagonist with god-like destructive power. This technique will become his signature attack for eliminating those who defy him.

events.title: Gan Fall and Pierre Rescue Luffy and Conis
events.description: Just before the lightning strike connects, Gan Fall riding Pierre swoops in at the last moment to rescue both Luffy and Conis from Enel's El Thor attack. They escape the blast zone as the massive lightning column destroys the area where they were standing.
events.significance: Gan Fall demonstrates his role as a protector of the innocent and establishes him as someone willing to oppose Enel's tyranny. This rescue cements the alliance between Gan Fall and the Straw Hats, and shows Pierre's Devil Fruit transformation abilities in action during a critical moment.

events.title: Gan Fall Revealed as Former God of Skypiea
events.description: After the rescue, Gan Fall is identified as the previous God of Skypiea who ruled before Enel took over. This explains his knowledge of Skypiea's affairs and his motivation to help those suffering under Enel's oppressive regime.
events.significance: This revelation provides crucial context for Gan Fall's character and the political history of Skypiea. It establishes that Enel is a usurper who overthrew the legitimate ruler, adding depth to the conflict and explaining why Gan Fall operates as a mercenary knight helping people in secret.

events.title: Explanation of Enel's Surveillance System
events.description: The episode explains how Enel maintains his omniscient control over Skypiea: he uses Mantra (Observation Haki) enhanced by his Goro Goro no Mi Devil Fruit to detect electromagnetic waves, allowing him to overhear conversations across the entire sky island and punish dissenters instantly with lightning strikes.
events.significance: Establishes the mechanics of Enel's god-like surveillance and punishment system, explaining how he maintains absolute control through fear. This also introduces viewers to the concept that Devil Fruits can enhance other abilities like Haki.

events.title: Luffy Resolves to Go to Upper Yard
events.description: Despite witnessing Enel's overwhelming power and learning about the danger, Luffy declares his determination to go to Upper Yard to rescue Zoro, Nami, Chopper, and Robin who were taken there by the Express Speedy Shrimp. Gan Fall asks what Luffy will do, and Luffy firmly states he will save his friends.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's unwavering loyalty to his crew and his refusal to be intimidated by powerful enemies, no matter how god-like they appear. This decision sets up the direct confrontation between the Straw Hats and Enel.

quotes.text: We will go to Upper Yard and save our friends.
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's determination after witnessing Enel's power

events.title: Boarding the Karasumaru
events.description: The episode ends with Luffy, Sanji, and Usopp boarding Gan Fall's ship, the Karasumaru, to travel to Upper Yard and rescue their crew members despite the dangers that await them there.
events.significance: Marks the transition from Angel Island to the next phase of the Skypiea arc, moving the story toward the direct confrontation with Enel and his priests in Upper Yard.

themes.description: Conis chooses to follow her conscience and warn the Straw Hats about the trap, despite knowing it will result in her own death. This demonstrates the power of individual moral courage against tyrannical oppression.
themes.symbolism: Conis's trembling represents her internal struggle between self-preservation and doing what's right, ultimately choosing the latter.

themes.description: The episode explores how Enel maintains absolute control over Skypiea through constant surveillance and the threat of instant divine punishment, creating a society where citizens are forced to betray their own values to survive.
themes.symbolism: El Thor/Heaven's Judgment serves as the physical manifestation of Enel's oppressive rule - swift, inescapable, and devastating.
culturalReferences: The concept of an omniscient deity punishing those who speak against them parallels various religious and mythological traditions

themes.description: Luffy's unwavering determination to rescue his crew members despite facing a seemingly god-like enemy demonstrates the strength of the bonds between the Straw Hat Pirates.
themes.symbolism: Luffy running toward danger rather than away from it symbolizes his nature as a protector and leader.

characterSpotlights.development: Conis overcomes her fear of Enel to confess the truth to the Straw Hats, showing immense courage and moral strength. This is her defining character moment in the series.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended some scenes of the Straw Hats walking through Lovely Street to show more of the marketplace atmosphere and citizen reactions.
The destruction caused by El Thor is shown more extensively in the anime with additional animation of houses being destroyed.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first on-screen use of Enel's signature technique El Thor, which would become his primary method of executing 'divine punishment' throughout the Skypiea arc.
The episode is based on Chapter 244 of the manga, titled 'SOS', which covers pages 2-19 of that chapter.
This episode aired with a TV rating of 12.9% in Japan, ranking 6th in viewership for that week.
The technique 'Mantra' introduced in Skypiea is later revealed to be Observation Haki (Kenbunshoku Haki), one of the three types of Haki in the One Piece world.
J. Michael Tatum, who voices Enel in the English dub, is known for often voicing sophisticated villain characters in anime.
Lovely Street makes its first appearance in this episode as the main marketplace of Angel Island in Skypiea.
